> Could you please elaborate why, after this change, pmon will not make any unsolicit mux notifications?

explained in the description as well, ycabled port instances get created repeatedly due to unwanted OIR(hot online insertion removal)
events. due to initalization in mux simulator it will cause unwanted requests of state and post that into state DB

only fixing UT and coverage, will merge soon, ETA 3/14

@yuazhe please run these:

> 
> 1. https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-mgmt/blob/master/tests/platform_tests/daemon/test_psud.py
> 2. https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-mgmt/blob/master/tests/platform_tests/api/test_psu_fans.py
> 3. https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-mgmt/blob/master/tests/platform_tests/api/test_psu.py

updated.
@prgeor any further feedback?
@yuazhe can you describe what sonic-mgmt test is failing? What exactly is the issue? if its a timing issue can you explain the sequence of event. Why is this specific to your platform?

@prgeor I have described the failure flow above, where after turning off the psu, the psu status could be still ok while other fields has became N/A. That happens because there is no atomicity in those getting functions, the psu physic status are simultaneously changing while we reading it, so we should build to well defined reading sequence to prevent the most important data is up to data, means to read them at the least time. This issue is **not** specific to our platform.

sure, addressed the conflict.
Does it support dynamic port break out?

> Does it support dynamic port break out?

Yes, it would be compatible with DPB, because sff_mgr listens to config update, and always keeps the local port_dict data updated.

> Can you please manually cause the SffManagerTask thread to crash due to an exception and then ensure that the traceback is printed in the log followed by xcvrd restarting?

Yes, trace was printed in syslog followed by restart:
```
Dec 20 06:33:21.528163 sonic ERR pmon#xcvrd[25125]: Traceback (most recent call last):
Dec 20 06:33:21.528178 sonic ERR pmon#xcvrd[25125]:   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.9/dist-packages/xcvrd/sff_mgr.py", line 213, in run
Dec 20 06:33:21.528178 sonic ERR pmon#xcvrd[25125]:     self.task_worker()
Dec 20 06:33:21.528178 sonic ERR pmon#xcvrd[25125]:   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.9/dist-packages/xcvrd/sff_mgr.py", line 302, in task_worker
Dec 20 06:33:21.528202 sonic ERR pmon#xcvrd[25125]:     if not port_mapping.handle_port_update_event(
Dec 20 06:33:21.528202 sonic ERR pmon#xcvrd[25125]:   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.9/dist-packages/xcvrd/xcvrd_utilities/port_mapping.py", line 237, in handle_port_update_event
Dec 20 06:33:21.528211 sonic ERR pmon#xcvrd[25125]:     port_change_event_handler(port_change_event)
Dec 20 06:33:21.528211 sonic ERR pmon#xcvrd[25125]:   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.9/dist-packages/xcvrd/sff_mgr.py", line 150, in on_port_update_event
Dec 20 06:33:21.528221 sonic ERR pmon#xcvrd[25125]:     active_lanes = self.get_active_lanes_for_lport(lport, subport_idx,
Dec 20 06:33:21.528221 sonic ERR pmon#xcvrd[25125]:   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.9/dist-packages/xcvrd/sff_mgr.py", line 106, in get_active_lanes_for_lport
Dec 20 06:33:21.528228 sonic ERR pmon#xcvrd[25125]:     if subport_idx < 0 or subport_idx > self.DEFAULT_NUM_LANES_PER_PPORT:
Dec 20 06:33:21.528228 sonic ERR pmon#xcvrd[25125]: TypeError: '<' not supported between instances of 'str' and 'int'
Dec 20 06:33:21.528314 sonic ERR pmon#xcvrd[25125]: Xcvrd: exception found at child thread SffManagerTask due to TypeError("'<' not supported between instances of 'str' and 'int'")
Dec 20 06:33:21.528314 sonic ERR pmon#xcvrd[25125]: Exiting main loop as child thread raised exception!

Dec 20 06:33:24.700706 sonic NOTICE pmon#xcvrd[25177]: Starting up...
